Donald Rumsfeld `` goes so far as to depict former George W. Bush as presiding over a national security process that was marked by incoherent decision-making and policy drift, most damagingly on the war in Iraq.'' Donald Rumsfeld remains largely unapologetic about his overall handling of the Iraq conflict and concludes that the war has been worth the costs. Had the government of Saddam Hussein remained in power, he says, the Middle East would be` far more perilous than it is today'. `` Addressing charges that he failed to provide enough troops for the war, he allows that,` In retrospect, there may have been times when more troops could have helped'.''

This triumvirate approach has real benefits in terms of shared wisdom, and we will continue to discuss the big decisions among the three of us. But we have also agreed to clarify our individual roles so there's clear responsibility and accountability at the top of the company. Eric Schmidt said Larry Page also will take the lead product development and technology strategy, while Sergey Brin will focus on strategic projects and have the title co-founder. Mike Pence does, gets one called by the elites, at mildest,`` an ideologue.'' Elitists may call reflecting the values of the people, or, as the Declaration of Independence phrased it, the consent of the governed, ideological. There is another, and better grounded, way to frame what is going on here: Mike Pence is a man of the people. That is, for him, a matter of principle.
